Description: Marl pottery jar of squat globular shape with rounded base, flat ledge-rim (chipped in one place), and two large cylindrical handles peaked at ends on the shoulders, pierced for suspension. Exterior decorated with red paint in a scale pattern covering the entire body and rim in imitation of stone.
Curator's comments: Like Decorated ware D63a in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. Published: A.J. Spencer, Early Egypt, London (1993), fig. 21
Condition: good; chipped at rim and at edges of handles.
